intro: Tupa domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican tupa, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, broad ovate leaves, and showy yellow flowers with five petals. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Due to habitat loss, Tupa domingensis is considered endangered and is of interest for conservation efforts.
